_prev_prog_3.Description: FACILITY IS SUBJECT TO CALOSHA PSM STANDARDS. THE FACILITY'S PSM PROGRAM MAKES UP  THE FACILITY'S PREVENTION PROGRAM IN ITS ENTIRETY

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Suburban Propane Elk Grove Terminal (SPEG) was designed, constructed, and is operated and maintained, in accordance with NFPA 58: Standard for Storage and Handling of Liquefied Petroleum Gases and/or the equivalent specification, Chicago Bridge & Iron General Specification 521-2-1.  Our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local regulations is demonstrated through SPEGA?s comprehensive accidental release prevention program for all critical process systems addressing design, installation, operating and maintenance procedures and schedules, and employee and contractor training and certification.  

In the event that an emergency event were to occur at the Elk Grove Terminal, response protocols have been developed and coordinated with offsite responders, including the Elk Grove Fire Department, the Elk Grove Police Department, the Sacramento County SheriffA?s Department and the Sacramento Metropolitan Fire District.  Moreover, the Elk Grove Terminal maintains onsite fire-fighting and emergency response systems and equipment to support and augment offsite emergency response resources.

Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled

The Suburban Propane Elk Grove Terminal is a bulk storage and transfer facility for liquid propane, SIC Code 5171/NAICS Code 42471: LPG Bulk Stations and Terminals. Propane is the only regulated substance handled at the facility.  The SPEG terminal is designed to receive and ship liquified propane gas by either rail or tanker. The terminal's storage capacity exceeds the federal threefold for this regulated substance.

In 2008 the Terminal's mailing address and site access changed from the south side of the facility to west side at 10455 East Stockton Blvd, Elk Grove, Ca.

Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical- Specific Prevention Steps
